title: River Road 2016 Stephanie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: With a bright, fresh and floral nose, this is a succulent and pleasurable wine, elegant and balanced, the fruit components layered in cherry, raspberry and strawberry.

title: Ruby 2016 Hendricks Legacy Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Still quite young, this offers concentrated raspberry fruit, with tangerine highlights. The acidity is spot-on, emphasizing the bright, ripe fruit, held in check by 10 months' aging in 10% new French oak.

title: Samsara 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a dark red-fruit element that starts the deep nose of this wine, but then come brighter red cherries, carnation and vanilla spice. Tart red cherries and nutmeg show on the sip, where a grippy texture and just enough acidity make for a solid appellation blend.

title: San Salvatore 1988 2015 Elea White (Paestum)
description: The striking nose offers sea breeze, tropical fruit, toasted nuts and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The elegant palate doles out pineapple, ripe yellow apple, peach and citrus alongside bright crisp acidity and a hint of saline. A coffee note lingers on the close.

title: Schnaitmann 2015 Steinwiege Trocken Pinot Noir (Württemberg)
description: Dark minerals and savory notes of herb, moss and roasted beet lend complexity to ripe blackberry and plum flavors here. It's an approachably fruity wine balanced by fresh, zippy acidity and firm grippy tannins on the finish. Drinks well now but should hold through 2023.

title: Sol Vie 2015 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This young wine is tight and tart, with the characteristic McMinnville underpinnings of cement and wet stone. The structure and balance are in fine proportion; it just needs more bottle age to unwind. Decant or cellar another year or two before opening.

title: Structure 2015 Foundation Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Stillwater Creek, Upland, Boushey and Destiny Ridge vineyards comprise equal parts of this 100% varietal wine. Light in color, it has pleasing aromas that suggest dried and fresh herb, along with toasty spice, cherry and moist earth. Full, luscious, pure cherry flavors are followed by a lingering finish. It's a winner.

title: Tamber Bey 2014 Deux Chevaux Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Robust in tobacco, cocoa powder and black currant, this is a structured, integrated and ultimately balanced wine, softened by small additions of Merlot and Petit Verdot. It shows structure and grace within a wall of blackberry and vanilla.

title: Verve 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: With a waxy, floral nose, this wine is made in a big style with power and concentration, its fruit profile marked by a wealth of raspberry and dark cherry. Present oak is spiked in persistent spice.

title: Vidon Vineyard 2016 Apollo Chardonnay (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Fermented in a single 600-liter barrel, this reserve-level wine leads with intense, sharp-toned concentration. Its bright apple and peach fruit morphs into softer banana flavors, and a light touch of toast carries into the finish. A bit more bottle age will help; drink 2020–2025.

title: Vie Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine yields ripe citrus, melon and vanilla aromas, along with waxy minerally notes that add delicious complexity. It's technically light-bodied in terms of alcohol but fills out the palate nicely and lingers on the finish, echoing oak spice and mineral tones.

title: Villa Raiano 2016  Fiano di Avellino
description: Aromas of smoke, Mediterranean brush, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff nut drift out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate doles out yellow pear, Golden Delicious apple, thyme and lemon zest while hint of bitter almond closes the finish.

title: Viola 2016 Barbera d'Alder Alder Ridge Vineyard Barbera (Horse Heaven Hills)
description: Aged in stainless steel and fermented with native yeasts, this has freshly crushed cranberry, raspberry and lemon peel aromas and pure flavors that undulate across the palate with compelling texture. Fresh raspberry notes persist on the tart finish. It's flat-out delicious and should shine at the dinner table.

title: Antonio Caggiano 2016 Béchar  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: Compelling aromas of pressed yellow flower, Mediterranean brush, citrus zest and smoke prove this wine's Fiano pedigree. The aromas carry over to the elegant structured palate along with yellow apple, lemon, toasted hazelnut and a drop of honey. Fresh acidity provides balance.

title: Brooks 2015 Rastaban Brooks Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This estate reserve is produced from biodynamic grapes. It's sweet and spicy, with concentrated raspberry fruit, baking spice and hints of toasted coconut. A touch riper than the previous vintage, it's already drinking well.

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)
description: Ripe tropical fruit in the aroma, fresh clean flavors and a rich texture buoyed by good acidity make this medium-bodied wine easy to like. Barrel-fermented in mostly neutral oak, it's smooth and fairly broad on the palate, and stays nice and dry and firm on the finish.

title: Cast 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the famous site along Westside Road, this red is medium bodied and sultry, with a backdrop of Asian baking spice. Tangy pomegranate, orange and rose petal fill out its entry and midpalate with exotic fresh flavor.

title: Castello di Gabbiano 2013 Bellezza Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this opens with aromas of black plum, vanilla, eucalyptus and a touch of ginger. The savory, balanced palate doles out ripe black cherry, licorice, white pepper and cedar alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Château du Cèdre 2015 Red (Cahors)
description: Dominated by 90% Malbec, this is the main estate wine of this producer. Its tannins are there, although they are relatively smooth and certainly balanced by the great black fruits. The wine is still young. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Jolys 2016 Cuvée Jean  (Jurançon)
description: Beautifully poised between sweetness and crisp acidity, this wine has baked apple, honey and apricot flavors. A tang from the ripe, late-harvest fruit contrasts with the more generous texture. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Château Lagrézette 2016 Seigneur de Grezette Malbec (Cahors)
description: Seigneur means lord of the manor, yet this is a modern, smooth style of Malbec. It's packed with fruit as much as tannins. Rich berry flavors laced with crisp acidity yield a wine that is poised and elegant. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Vincens 2014 Les Graves de Paul Malbec (Cahors)
description: Almost black in color, this is a dense and fruit-driven wine. Powerful tannins and oak aging play a supporting role, showing the ageworthiness of the wine. Produced from the best gravelly parcels of the estate with low yields, this concentrated wine needs to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Vincens 2016 Origine Malbec (Cahors)
description: This bold, black-colored, black-fruit-flavored wine also offers rich tannins, layers of toasty spice and acidity. The 15 months in wood have given a ripe, full-bodied wine that will age further. Drink this powerful wine from 2022.

title: Clos Solène 2016 Hommage Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Plumeria, honey and poached pear aromas show on the rounded, ripe and yet somewhat reserved nose of this blend of 75% Roussanne and 25% Viognier. The palate is both tropical and extremely fresh, with pear flesh and light guava flavors wrapped up in a bountiful acid and grippy texture.

title: Clos Troteligotte 2015 K-Lys Malbec (Cahors)
description: This is an open, juicy wine, full of berries backed by tannins. Produced from organically grown grapes, the wine is an immediately friendly take on Malbec, never letting the tannins stand in the way of its delicious fruit. Drink from 2020.

title: Companhia das Quintas 2013 Herdade da Farizoa Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This blend, which is dominated by Syrah along with Touriga Nacional and Aragonez, brings out bold tannins and ripe black fruits. Perfumed and richly textured, the wine is packed with fruitiness, backed by a solid structure and a smooth aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Fattoria La Rivolta 2016 Taburno Fiano (Sannio)
description: This delicious, elegant white opens with aromas of ripe white stone fruit, fragrant yellow flower, Mediterranean brush and a whiff of honey. The tangy juicy palate delivers yellow pear, nectarine, ginger and toasted hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.

title: Grosset 2017 Springvale Riesling (Clare Valley)
description: This wine expresses bright yet dainty lime zest, floral and talc characters. The palate is fine and focused, with crisp, bright, citric acidity and a wet stone minerality. Watch this little beauty morph with time. Drink now–2033 at least.

title: Maison Jussiaume 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Rogue Valley)
description: From Winemaker Jean-Michel Jussiaume, this sparkling wine is produced entirely from Chardonnay sourced from the Del Rio Vineyard. It offers concentrated lemon, grapefruit and pineapple flavors, with a fine bead and impeccable overall balance.

title: MC4 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a one-acre vineyard site, made in small amounts, this impresses in waxy cherry and vanilla flavors dipped in toasted clove. Soft, round and pleasantly approachable, it offers a touch of grip on the finish.
